hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurairah: The Prophet ﷺ said: Whoever separates himself from the community and departs from obedience, and then dies, his death is of the days of ignorance (Jahiliyyah). Whoever fights against my community with a sword, striking both the righteous and the immoral, not avoiding a believer on account of his faith, nor fulfilling a covenant with one bound by covenant, he is not from my community. Whoever is killed under a banner of blind rage, fighting for tribalism, or calling to tribalism, his death is a death of ignorance.

hadiths.english_translation: Yahya informed me that al-Harith al-Ash'ari told him that the Prophet ﷺ said: I command you with five things: Hearing, obedience, the community, migration, and jihad in the way of Allah. Whoever leaves the community even by a hand's span has removed the rope of Islam from his neck until he returns. Whoever calls with the call of ignorance, he is from the coals of Hellfire. A man asked: Even if he prayed and fasted? The Prophet ﷺ replied: Yes, even if he prayed and fasted, unless he names himself with the name by which Allah named you as servants of Allah, the believers.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated that Umar ibn al-Khattab stood as a speaker at al-Jabiyah and said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ stood among us as I am standing among you. He said: Honor my companions, for they are the best of you. Then those who come after them, then those who come after them. Then falsehood will appear, until a person will swear an oath on a matter without being asked, and will give testimony without being asked. Whoever desires the bliss of Paradise, let him adhere to the community, for Satan is with the one alone, and he is further away from two. Let no man be alone with a woman, for Satan is the third with them. Whoever is pleased by his good deeds and saddened by his evil deeds is a believer.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated that Khalid ibn Khalid al-Yashkuri said: I traveled during the time when Tustar was conquered until I came to Kufa. I entered the mosque and found a group of distinguished men with a handsome face, known to be from the men of Hijaz. I asked: Who is this man? They said: Don't you know him? He is Hudhayfa ibn al-Yaman, the companion of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. Hudhayfa told the people that people used to ask the Messenger of Allah ﷺ about good, while I used to ask him about evil. The Prophet ﷺ said: Yes, evil will come after this good just as it came before it. I asked: What is the protection from it? He said: The sword. I asked: What comes after the sword? He said: There will be a rulership over defective people and a truce upon resentment. Then will come callers to misguidance. If Allah has a caliph on earth at that time, he will strike your back and take your wealth, so stick with him; otherwise die while biting a tree root. Then will come the Dajjal after that with a river and fire. Whoever falls in his fire will receive reward and have burden removed, and whoever falls in his river will have burden added and reward removed. Then will come the emergence of the mule who will not be ridden until the Hour is established.

By Allah, I will never be brought a man from you who fell into what I forbade people from, except I double his punishment on account of his position with me. So whoever wishes may go forward and whoever wishes may stay back.

hadiths.english_translation: From al-Zuhri from Humayd ibn Abd al-Rahman: al-Miswar ibn Makhramah related to me that he was delegated to Mu'awiyah. When he entered to him, Mu'awiyah said: What have you done with your criticism of the leaders, O Miswar? He said: I said: Either cease from this or do well toward what we come for. Mu'awiyah said: You will speak with yourself. He said: I did not leave anything to criticize him with except I told him. He said: I am not free from sins. Do you have sins that you fear would destroy you if Allah does not forgive them for you? I said: Yes. He said: What makes you more deserving of forgiveness from me? By Allah, I am not negligent in reconciling people, establishing the boundaries, and jihad in the way of Allah and the great matters which you count as more than what I do. And I am upon a religion where Allah accepts good deeds and pardons evil deeds. By Allah, moreover, I would never choose between Allah and other than Him except to choose Allah over everything else. He said: I reflected when he said what he said, and I found he had argued me into silence, and whenever he remembered him after that, he prayed for him.

hadiths.english_translation: From Ibn Khuthaym from Abd al-Rahman ibn Sabit from Jabir ibn Abdullah: The Prophet ﷺ said to Ka'b ibn Ujrah: May Allah protect you, O Ka'b ibn Ujrah, from the rulership of the foolish. He said: What is the rulership of the foolish? He said: Rulers who will come after me, they do not follow my guidance, nor do they follow my Sunnah. Whoever confirms them in their falsehood and helps them in their oppression, those are not from me and I am not from them, and they will not reach my Pool. And whoever does not confirm them in their falsehood and does not help them in their oppression, those are from me and I am from them, and they will reach my Pool, O Ka'b ibn Ujrah. Fasting is a shield, and charity extinguishes sin, and prayer is a means of closeness or evidence. O Ka'b ibn Ujrah, flesh that grows from ill-gotten gain will never enter Paradise, the Fire is more worthy of it. O Ka'b ibn Ujrah, the people are two travelers: one buying himself and freeing himself, or selling himself and destroying himself.
